definition: Mahābhārata, second great Indian epic after 羅摩衍那|罗摩衍那[Luo2 mo2 yan3 na4], possibly originally c. 4th century BC

sentences.english: You see, these Bodhisattvas Mahasattvas are able to obtain great benefit.
sentences.chinese: 汝觀彼諸菩薩摩訶薩，善獲利益。

sentences.english: He was just this Bodhisattva Mahasattva Wondrous Sound.
sentences.chinese: 今此妙音菩薩摩訶薩是。

sentences.english: This dhamma desana of Than Acharn Maha Boowa is a rare and special one.
sentences.chinese: 尊者阿姜摩訶布瓦這次的宣講是稀有罕見特別的一次。

sentences.english: This can be proven through the epic Mahabharata.
sentences.chinese: 史詩《摩訶婆羅多》就可以證明這點。

sentences.english: Shri Mahakali is the power of your left side, the power of desire.
sentences.chinese: 摩訶迦利是你左脈的力量，願望的力量。

sentences.english: Maha Samadhi is the final conscious abandoning of the physical body.
sentences.chinese: 摩訶三摩地是放棄物理身體的最終意識。

sentences.english: Mahabharata is an educational book which touched ours hearts.
sentences.chinese: 《摩訶婆羅多》是一部觸及人類心靈的警世之作。

definition: meaning (of foreign expression)/translation of the meaning (as opposed to literal translation 直譯|直译)/paraphrase/free translation
Kumarajiva c. 334-413, Buddhist monk and translator of Zen texts
the Eternal Wheel of life in Buddhism
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
Gautama, surname of the Siddhartha, the historical Buddha
Buddha Kassapa (Pāli) or Kāśyapa (Skt) (one of the Buddhas of the past)
so I have heard (idiom)/the beginning clause of Buddha's quotations as recorded by his disciple, Ananda (Buddhism)
pattra palm tree (Corypha umbraculifera), whose leaves were used as paper substitute for Buddhist sutras
